intro: Hieracium apricorum, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully develop. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and hairy. Hieracium apricorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
